Package gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc

Class SatelliteSituationCenterRest.ClientRequestCounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc.SatelliteSituationCenterRest.ClientRequestCounts
  • Enclosing class:
    SatelliteSituationCenterRest
    private static class SatelliteSituationCenterRest.ClientRequestCounts
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a thread safe mechanism for tracking the number of currently active requests that each client has.
    Since:
    2.3.1

      Client request counts.

      Maximum number of active requests any one client is allowed to make.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_REQUESTS

        private static final int MAX_REQUESTS
        Maximum number of active requests any one client is allowed to make.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • clientRequestCounts

        private static final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger> clientRequestCounts
        Client request counts. The key identifies the client (IP address) and the value contains a count of the number of currently active requests from the client. The number of requests is incremented when the request is received and decremented when the request is complete. When the count reaches zero, the client is removed from this Map. LongAdder was considered instead of AtomicInteger but AtomicInteger's semantics seemed better for this case.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientRequestCounts

        private ClientRequestCounts()

    • Method Detail

      • exceedsLimitOrIncrement

        private static boolean exceedsLimitOrIncrement​(java.lang.String client)
        Determines if a new request will exceed the per-client request limit. If not, the client's current request count is incremented.
        Parameters:
        client - client identifier.
        Returns:
        true if client is at their limit. false, otherwise.

      • decrement

        private static void decrement​(java.lang.String client)
        Decrements the specified client's request count. When the count reaches zero, the client is removed from the clientRequestCounts map.
        Parameters:
        client - client identifier.

      • getCounts

        private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<XHtmlStatusPage.Status<? extends java.lang.Number>>> getCounts()
        Gets status information.
        Returns:
        status information.
